list.title: HTML
list.desc: I didn't try using all tags. But I can choose what I need when I develop UI. And I've been using new HTML tags since HTML5. Such as canvas, video, audio, semantic tags.

list.title: CSS
list.desc: I can develop responsive UI which designers made and simple animations. This link is where I usually check to improve my skill.

list.title: JavaScript
list.desc: It's the language which I've been using the most since I started developing web. Because of simularity with Dart, I could learn it fast. I'm trying to fill what is lacking by reading deep dive book. Nowadays, I've been using TypeScript to check type and error in compile time.

list.title: TypeScript
list.desc: JavaScript is hard to check the type of value before debugging unlike Dart or Kotlin, Java. etc. So I started using typescript to get rid of errors in compile time.

list.title: React
list.desc: When I started studying, I used class component. It was easy to learn because of similarity with Flutter. But I needed to study harder since it moved to functional component. Nowadays, I think I'm used to with that. And separating logic and view with customhooks seemed good.

list.title: Redux
list.desc: I started using global state management to avoid of props drilling. And I'm trying not to use much as long as it can be complexed more. Nowadays, I'm using Zustand. Because it has a same Flux structure and can get rid of boiler plate. And also, the bundle size is smaller.

list.title: Svelte
list.desc: In my first company, our main product was a mobile app. And we needed a web site for products. So our team started studying it. Actually, I like the concept of Svelte. Such as two way binding, without virtual dom, reactive state management, etc. Just there weren't many companies where use that.

list.title: Flutter
list.desc: I started my developer career as a Flutter developer. I've been developing with MVVM structure with that. And I developed my personal app and published package which is used more than 100 apps.

list.title: Bundler
list.desc: I use this to build my react app. I just tried basic settings and put some features for some libraries. But nowadays, I prefer to use Vite because of bundling speed. I can check the result faster.

list.title: Node
list.desc: I'm using it for a simple test server with MVC structure. Since my back end knowledge is not enough, I've been studying more about DB and OS. My goal is to be a full stack developer with that.

list.title: Express
list.desc: I use it to develope node easier. Especially, routing is the best part of using it. I'm considering Nest too.

list.title: MongoDB
list.desc: I'm currently studying it. I already tried simple CRUD and etc. I'm willing to use this for my side project in the future.

list.title: Android
list.desc: I developed Android before starting to develop Flutter. This basic was helpful when I developed Flutter. Especially, when I needed to use native features, I could do with Method channel and Flatform view with Kotlin.

list.title: Firebase
list.desc: When I made a portfolio for my first career as a developer, I made a simple community app with Flutter and Firebase.

list.title: SQLite
list.desc: I had used when I developed a mobile app or simple node server. I think I need to study bigger DB for my entire career.

list.title: WebRTC
list.desc: One of interesting skills. I could have developed Web, App, Signal server and made peer to peer video calling.

list.title: Three.js
list.desc: One of interesting skills. Because I was wondering how 3D is developed. So I looked for WebGL and WebGPU. And I chose Three.js. Because WebGPU is still not supported perfectly.

list.title: NGINX
list.desc: I have an experiene of using it when I needed to publish react app in customer's pc. I applied features such as entry point(build folder), proxy, timeout, etc.
